      public boolean hasValidSignature​(@NotNull @NotNull java.security.PrivateKey empiricalPrivateRSAKey, @NotNull @NotNull java.security.PublicKey empiricalPublicRSAKey) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Method to check if the IssuerPartAttestation has a valid signature.
      Parameters:
      empiricalPrivateRSAKey - The empirical private RSA key of the attestation.
      empiricalPublicRSAKey - The empirical public RSA key of the attestation.
      Returns:

      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided Key arguments can't be used to verify the signature.

    • hasValidSignature

      public boolean hasValidSignature​(@NotNull @NotNull PrivateEntityIdentifier privateEntityIdentifierReceiver, @NotNull @NotNull PublicEntityIdentifier publicEntityIdentifierIssuer, @NotNull @NotNull RTreePolicy policy) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Method to check if the IssuerPartAttestation has a valid signature.
      Parameters:
      privateEntityIdentifierReceiver - The PrivateEntityIdentifier of the user receiving the IssuerPartAttestation.
      publicEntityIdentifierIssuer - The PublicEntityIdentifier of the issuer used to encrypt the AES encryption information segment with.
      policy - The RTreePolicy for the Attestation.
      Returns:
      True if the IssuerPartAttestation has a valid signature; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided arguments can't be used to verify the signature.
